greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1, a(2)=2, a(3*2^k) = 3*2^k, a(3*2^k + i) = 3*2^k + a(3*2^k - i), for i in range [1, 3*2^k - 1].
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..12288
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
mathematica: a = {1, 2}; Do[a = Join[a, {3*2^k}, 3*2^k + Reverse[a]], {k, 0, 4}]; a (* _Ivan Neretin_, Sep 04 2017 *)
program: (MIT Scheme:) (define (A096114 n) (cond ((< n 3) n) ((and (zero? (modulo n 3)) (pow2? (/ n 3))) n) (else (let ((lastfix (* 3 (expt 2 (A000523 (floor->exact (/ n 3))))))) (+ lastfix (A096114 (- (* 2 lastfix) n)))))))
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jun 29 2004
ext: Edited, extended and Scheme code added by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 25 2006
